title: Capturing and Utilizing Unconscious Experiential Learning in Organizations: Project-Based Learning Through Action Research

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic organizational behavior theory and experiential learning theory
context.additional_context: Learners are graduate students with beginner-level expertise in science, analyzing and systematizing cases of unconscious learning within organizations through project execution and reflective activities in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three cases of unconscious learning from organizational members' daily work experiences.
Learners can conduct qualitative analysis of experiential learning processes within organizations by applying action research methodology.

Learners can evaluate the transition process into a learning organization using retrospective reflective tools and propose strategies to integrate these insights into future educational program design.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
